section: This JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") made and entered into this 20th day of Friday, March 2020 (the "Execution Date")
explanation: The inclusion of "Friday" in the date description is a structural flaw. While not necessarily creating a legal contradiction, it is unconventional and unnecessary in a legal document. Legal dates generally follow the format: day, month, year.

section: Member Duties Description BorrowMoney.com, inc *HTML code, build, deploy and maintain all technical aspect requirements including a database for medical dispatch personal & product service as needed, including activity information, data storage and backup. provided by three qualified assigned Borrowmoney.com, inc. employees/personal JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: This section outlines the duties of each member. For JVLS, LLC, it states that they need to pay $60,000 within 90 days. The term 'Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract' is vague. It's not clear what defines an 'awarded contract'. This is ambiguous in text, leading to potential disputes over what revenue is subject to the 10% contribution.

section: Each of the Members has contributed to the capital of the Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value, as follows (the "Capital Contribution"): Member Contribution Description Agreed Value BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The capital contributions section presents a discrepancy. BorrowMoney.com is contributing 1,500 square feet of leased office space, which is valued at $3,500,000.00 USD. JVLS, LLC contributes $60,000 in cash plus 10% of the generated gross revenue, which is valued at $3,500,000.00 USD. It is highly unlikely that $60,000 plus 10% of revenue would equal the same amount as 1,500 square feet of office space. This seems like a mistake or a misrepresentation of value. It is an inconsistency in the text.
